page.title: 06RELIGION IN CROOK,CUMBRIA
page.content: THE CHURCH OF ST.CATHERINE AT CROOK,IN THE CARLISLE DIOCESE,IS A STONE-BUILT BUILDING 98 YEARS OLD.A SERVICE IS HELD EACH SUNDAY AT 10.00a.m.WITH EUCHARIST ONCE A MONTH.THE USUAL CHURCH OF ENGLAND FESTIVALS ARE CELEBRATED;HARVEST,EASTER,CHRISTMAS, AND THERE ARE OCCASIONAL BAPTISMS, WEDDINGS AND FUNERALS.IT IS A SHARED MINISTRY WITH ST.THOMAS'S CHURCH IN KENDAL. THE GRAVEYARD,ON VERY ROCKY GROUND,IS STILL IN USE,AND THE GRAVEDIGGER HOLDS AN EXPLOSIVES LICENCE TO PERMIT HIM TO BLAST ROCK WHERE NECESSARY.THERE ARE NO DOUBLE GRAVES AND NO OVER-ALL PLAN -GRAVES ARE DUG WHERE THE GROUND IS SUITABLE.AS YET NO PROVISION IS MADE FOR THE INTERMENT OF ASHES. A MONTHLY DISCUSSION GROUP IS HELD IN MEMBERS' HOMES,BUT THE YOUNG PEOPLE'S GROUP HAS NO LEADER.
